org.codehaus.preon
Interface CodecFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayCodecFactory, BooleanCodecFactory, BoundBufferCodecFactory, CachingCodecFactory, CompoundCodecFactory, DefaultCodecFactory, EnumCodec.Factory, ExplicitCodecFactory, ListCodecFactory, MapCodecFactory, NumericCodec.Factory, ObjectCodecFactory, StringCodecFactory
public interface CodecFactory

A factory for Codecs. A CodecFactory is not tightly coupled to a certain type of Codec.

Author:
Wifred Springer

Method Summary
<T> Codec<T>
create(AnnotatedElement metadata, Class<T> type, ResolverContext context)
          Constructs a new Codec.
 

Method Detail

create

<T> Codec<T> create(AnnotatedElement metadata,
                    Class<T> type,
                    ResolverContext context)
Constructs a new Codec. The metadata argument is used for passing data on the expectations of the clients of the factory.

The client might choose not to pass any metadata at all, basically leaving it up to the factory to make its own decisions based on type information only. The client might also pass an empty AnnotatedElement.

Note the subtle difference here. Passing null means: if you can create a Codec for this type, then please do so. Passing an empty AnnotatedElement means: please give me a Codec for the given type, but only if you find an annotation that explicitly tells you to do so.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the objects to be returned by the Codec.
Parameters:
metadata - A bucket of metadata, used by the the factory to determine if it should be creating a Codec for a certain type, but also how the Codec should be created.
type - The type of the objects to be returned by the Codec. (Not null).
context - The context for creating references.
Returns:
A new Codec for the given type.
